programme.title: Barnwood Builders

programme.title: Barnwood Builders

programme.title: Barnwood Builders

programme.title: Barnwood Builders

programme.title: Barnwood Builders

programme.title: Dr. Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Her actual name is Sandra Lee, but she is so popular in her field of dermatology that she is known by most people as Dr. Pimple Popper. In 2015, Dr. Lee began to provide a window into her job by filming dermatological procedures -- some quite gruesome, like blackhead extractions and cyst dissections -- and posting them to her website and across other social media outlets. Lo and behold, the content has been viewed by millions of people, who now have their own designation -- Popaholics. Now comes a reality show on TLC, which says Lee is a "celebrity who has pioneered the fastest growing medical fascination in decades.".

programme.desc: Curiosity is a powerful motivator for brothers Rick and Marty Lagina, and it leads them to Nova Scotia, Canada. The two preview what's in store as they pull double duty. Historians and reenactments help tell the tales of the notorious figures who left these riches behind.

programme.title: Savage Outdoors
programme.desc: It's bear season in Alaska, and Mike has been waiting four years to get this permit. He's got an itch to take down a big bear, and the savage is sighted in.

programme.title: Backwoods Life
programme.desc: Michael Lee and Kevin Knighton have drawn gun tags for Iowa bucks. The last time either of them were in Iowa they shot too fast, so they're trying to redeem themselves with Iowa giants.

programme.title: Small Town Hunting

programme.title: Hoge Wild

programme.title: My World Outdoors
programme.desc: JC heads to central Kansas and closes the deal on his first whitetail, a big 10 point, with a bow. JC hunts with Salt Grass Outfitters in early October with hopes of getting within archery range of a feeding patterned buck.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Cherry Healey is in South Africa visiting one of the largest iron ore mines in the world. Gregg Wallace is in France at a foundry that produces a cast iron pot every five seconds. And historian Ruth Goodman takes a journey through time.

programme.title: North America with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon begins his most ambitious journey yet; travelling the entire length of the Americas. In this first leg, Simon travels from Alaska, down through Canada to Vancouver.

programme.title: Spectacular Earth
programme.desc: Volcan del Fuego in Guatemala is one of the most 'explosive' volcanoes of them all. To reveal what's happening within the volcano, visit the 'new' Island of Surtsey, flamingos flocking in Kenya, and a boiling geyser in Iceland. Witness the daring attempt to lower a data gathering probe right into the crater of a volcano just before it erupts.

programme.title: Life Below Zero: Canada
programme.desc: Kim and Pierre redouble their efforts to harvest a moose; Becky pushes herself to the limit for her dogs; Bentley and his father build a summer runway for their plane; Jon and his two sons look to the past to help them build for their future.

programme.title: The World's Deadliest Weather
programme.desc: Hurricane Harvey, the most powerful hurricane in a decade to strike the United States, rips a coastal town apart and dumps a once-in-a-thousand-year rainfall that drowns the city of Houston.

programme.desc: Gregg visits the biggest cider factory in the world, which produces more than 350 million litres each year, and Cherry explores how the factory is creating new orchards of an apple variety called Scrumptious through the ancient technique of grafting.

programme.title: Earth from Space
programme.desc: From space Earth is a kaleidoscope. Turquoise plankton blooms trigger a feeding frenzy, China turns yellow with rapeseed flowers, and mysterious green lights appear in the ocean.

programme.desc: In this first episode, Samira journeys to places rarely seen by western audiences to reveal how the Persian Empire was born, the mysterious writing of its early people and how Iran's powerful kings built a vast empire that became the envy of the ancient world.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace gets to grips with socks at a factory in Leicester, Cherry finds out which socks best tackle smelly feet, and Ruth Goodman steps back into the 1980s, when socks were at the height of fashion.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Hide and Seek follows tigers, harpy eagles, chimpanzees, army ants and other predators as they rise to the challenge of hunting within the forest - a dense, confusing, three-dimensional world.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: At the Gateway to India on Mumbai harbour, Joanna faces the beautiful stone archway through which she left India in 1947. She also explores India's caste system; an illegal classification that segregates people into social groups from birth.

programme.title: Spectacular Earth
programme.desc: The largest of all of Earth's displays stretches across thousands of kilometres in the night sky: the Aurora Borealis. The arctic wilderness of Northern Sweden is one of the best places to witness the aurora. Discover how it is created, by witnessing the beauty of total eclipses, a mass turtle migration in Costa Rica and powerful tidal whirlpools off the west coast of Scotland.

programme.title: Robson Green's Extreme Fishing Challenge
programme.desc: In eastern Canada, Robson Green goes large and attempts to catch his biggest ever Atlantic salmon and his biggest ever tuna.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins his adventures in Hong Kong, with railway highlights including the cable funicular to the top of Hong Kong's highest mountain, the Peak, and the enviably efficient and shiny Mass Transit System.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a two-part adventure through Thailand. Michael helps out at an elephant hospital, tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cuisine.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael continues his exploration of Thailand by rail, steered by his 1913 Bradshaw's guide. First, he steps into the ring under the guidance of champion trainer, Master Toddy, to learn Muay Thai boxing. Can he perfect the Cobra inspired right hook?

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards Vietnam's spectacular Reunification Railway to make a 1,000-mile journey from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi. He visits the container port of Haiphong and finishes in Halong Bay.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. Near the formidable imperial city of Hue, Michael meets milliner Mrs Ngo, who teaches him how to make the iconic conical hat.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the heaving megacity of Jakarta, Michael Portillo uncovers Indonesia's colonial past as part of a Dutch empire and its rich history as a port.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in Java's royal city, Yogyakarta, Michael Portillo visits the Sultan's Palace and witnesses the ancient art of shadow puppetry, known as wayang.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael rides one of the steepest and fastest funicular railways in the world and steps into a tropical paradise as he releases exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Kuala Lumpur, Michael tries the ancient art of pewter smithing and learns how the discovery of tin transformed a muddy estuary into Malaysia's thriving capital.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway tour reaches its final stop - Singapore. Michael walks the streets of Chinatown with a local artist and uncovers the history of the Chinese community there.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a factory in rural Somerset that produces one million pots of yogurt every 24 hours, while Cherry Healey helps out with the UK's biggest blackcurrant harvest.

programme.title: Wild Japan
programme.desc: The northern island of Hokkaido swings from Siberia-like winters to Mediterranean-like summers. Everything living on Japan's wildest island needs to be extra resilient to survive.

programme.title: Extreme Treks
programme.desc: The El Choro Trail starts in the lowland jungles of western Bolivia and finishes on the vast Alti-plano plateau that covers much of the country. The journey tracks a historical trading route used by locals for centuries.

programme.desc: Donal cooks some simple scallops with green peas and asparagus. For some ultimate din-spiration, check out his Lighter Dan Dan noodles and Crunchy Thai beef & mango salad. To top it all off, Donal's five-minute challenge sees him attempt to whip up Hoisin.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the second heat, the Skills Tests involve scallops and a crème pâtissière swiss roll. Then the chefs try to impress the judges with two Signature Dishes that demonstrate their culinary identities.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The signature round features plenty of alcohol, while the technical challenge sets the bakers the task of making pastry horns. Finally, for the Showstopper, they must use all the precision they can muster to construct a cake made entirely from smaller cak.

programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits rural East Sussex to meet deep-sea diver Adrian, who fell in love with cold uncompromising concrete in the skateparks of Scotland. Back in 2016 he had convinced wife Megan to build their new family home almost entirely out of the st.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Strap in for Dr. Amanda's risky attempt to collar a wild roan antelope. Later, chase down blue monkey Indigo while unrest ensues among the vervets. Examine an eagle owl with bumblefoot and say adieu to Sheila the croc, who's headed back to the wild.

programme.title: The Ocean's Greatest Feast
programme.desc: Get a front-row seat to the planet's biggest biomass migration, the annual 1,000-mile sardine run along South Africa's east coast. See billions of these tiny fish run a gauntlet of hungry predators, including stealthy seals and dive-bombing gannets.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Journey thousands of miles and observe the extremes that summer brings to Africa, from droughts and famine in some locations to abundance and feasting in others. Discover how this season tests the limits of animals and plants across the continent.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Track autumn's arrival in Africa and the epic migrations it kicks off. Peer into nooks and crannies, where some creatures find one last romance before cooler weather descends, while others enjoy seasonal feasts ahead of the leaner winter months.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue

programme.title: Zambia Untamed
programme.desc: In the Luangwa Valley, a grove of Ebony trees is home to a baboon troop. One youngster, Makupa, is the target of bullying because he's been born with white hair. Can his mother find support and elude the valley's lurking dangers to keep him safe?

programme.title: Zambia Untamed
programme.desc: The plains and woodlands of the Luangwa Valley are the most merciless of all the neighbourhoods. See how species learn to rely on each other to scout for danger, from baboons acting as lookouts to talkative guinea fowl sounding the alarm.

programme.title: Attack and Defend
programme.desc: Hunting is a means of survival for all predators. But some highly specialized killing machines, including the stealthy tarantula and the prehistoric Komodo dragon, have developed deadly adaptations that make them downright terrifying.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: Arabia's coral reefs are home to some of nature's most impressive illusionists. Creatures can pulsate with colour, transform in the blink of an eye, or perform riveting displays of showmanship. Because in these dangerous waters, disguise is crucial.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Africa is home to some of the largest, strangest, and most fearsome creatures on Earth. Our ancestors tried to understand their adaptations through stories, but modern science shows us that the truth is stranger than fiction.

programme.title: Attack and Defend
programme.desc: In the evolutionary arms race between predator and prey, highly adapted hunting techniques lead to specialized evasion tactics. From deadly poison to clever mimicry, explore the creatures that have outwitted their adversaries to live another day.

programme.title: Attack and Defend
programme.desc: Raw power, cunning patience, and swarm intelligence give the clash between predator and prey a new dynamic in the deep. Experience the offensive and defensive adaptations of lethal sharks, clever cuttlefish, and hypnotic shoals of fish.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running With The Pack
programme.desc: Connect with the three packs: the large Manzi pack in the lush heartland, the Kakuli pack in the Badlands, and the tiny Stork Colony pack living at the park's edge. Follow Julz as he shares their victories and defeats in this make-or-break season.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: Off the coast of Oman, summer weather drives nutrients in from the ocean depths where they meet the Arabian sun, causing an explosion of life. Smaller fish spawn, filling the waters with eggs. This creates a buffet predators just can't resist.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: In Zambia's Luangwa Valley live two special elephants. One lost half her trunk to a poacher's snare, and she must now learn how to live without her most important appendage. Meanwhile, her brother is forced to cut ties with his family.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Welcome baby orangutan Topan, an orphan in need of a surrogate mom. Watch her learning journey in nursery school while her fellow students move through junior, senior, and wild-immersion schools. Meanwhile, 16-year-old Kasper preps for graduation.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Get acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learn how billions of years' worth of changes, from ice ages to asteroid strikes, have shaped their looks and skills. Meet blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs, and much more.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: The Yucatan Peninsula is home to tourists, sea turtles, and sargassum seaweed. How do the three coexist in harmony? Is it sustainable? Uncover the secrets behind this Mexican beach, including an ancient birthing ritual that takes place each year.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: Get ready to understand the science behind Hawaii's stunning beaches. Why does sand appear white, yellow, black, green and red? How do active volcanoes change the coastline? Are other forces at play in shaping these incredible beaches?

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running With The Pack
programme.desc: Feel the heat as rising temps mean that water is getting scarce. The Manzi pack must stand alongside predators to hydrate at a remaining precious water spot. Hunt with Weka's pack to feed the pups, and watch the Stork Colony thrive against all odds.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running With The Pack
programme.desc: Agonize over a lost Stork pack puppy, and tussle with Manzi pups who are sorting their place in the hierarchy, figuring out noisy-neighbour friends and foes. Hop on a search mission with Julz for the missing Kakuli pack in the desolate Badlands.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: It's summer in the Gulf of Oman. The scorching Arabian sun heats the shallow waters to 86 degrees boosting the growth of algae across a vast coral reef. This attracts thousands of hungry herbivores creating a fish versus fish turf war.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Each of the Luangwa Valley's trees is a habitat in its own right. Discover the ways they provide food and shelter, enriching their massive ecosystem and making it a haven for sixty species of large mammals and hundreds of types of birds.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Observe blossoming friendships and interspecies bonds in nursery school, and peek inside a bromance among junior-school buds Valentino, Yutris, and Madara. See distractible Beni lean into his love of food and get a beating from a more-senior pupil.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Feel the love in the strange-but-heartwarming partnerships between some of Earth's oddest creatures. Dive deep to see strange animals, from snapping shrimp to wolf eels, offer a hand to their fellow ocean-going weirdos to ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: The Living Beach

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Observe blossoming friendships and interspecies bonds in nursery school, and peek inside a bromance among junior-school buds Valentino, Yutris, and Madara. See distractible Beni lean into his love of food and get a beating from a more-senior pupil.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Feel the love in the strange-but-heartwarming partnerships between some of Earth's oddest creatures. Dive deep to see strange animals, from snapping shrimp to wolf eels, offer a hand to their fellow ocean-going weirdos to ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: Many species call Zambia's Luangwa Valley home, but it has one of the toughest dry seasons imaginable-no rain for seven months and extreme temperatures. Yet for some animals, the dry season means opportunity.

programme.title: The Big Dry
programme.desc: It's October in Zambia's Luangwa Valley-the hottest and harshest time of year. There has been no rain since April and desperate animals are drawn to the only remaining source of water in the valley: the dwindling Luangwa River.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running With The Pack
programme.desc: Feel the heat as rising temps mean that water is getting scarce. The Manzi pack must stand alongside predators to hydrate at a remaining precious water spot. Hunt with Weka's pack to feed the pups, and watch the Stork Colony thrive against all odds.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: It's summer in the Gulf of Oman. The scorching Arabian sun heats the shallow waters to 86 degrees boosting the growth of algae across a vast coral reef. This attracts thousands of hungry herbivores creating a fish versus fish turf war.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: The Yucatan Peninsula is home to tourists, sea turtles, and sargassum seaweed. How do the three coexist in harmony? Is it sustainable? Uncover the secrets behind this Mexican beach, including an ancient birthing ritual that takes place each year.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Each of the Luangwa Valley's trees is a habitat in its own right. Discover the ways they provide food and shelter, enriching their massive ecosystem and making it a haven for sixty species of large mammals and hundreds of types of birds.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running With The Pack
programme.desc: Agonize over a lost Stork pack puppy, and tussle with Manzi pups who are sorting their place in the hierarchy, figuring out noisy-neighbour friends and foes. Hop on a search mission with Julz for the missing Kakuli pack in the desolate Badlands.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.desc: Dodge a leopard with the Manzi dogs while they treat themselves to a stolen feast. No such luck for the Kakuli pack on the hunt, as they're foiled by a brave puku antelope. Find the stork pack, and retreat from charging elephants with Jules and Simon.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.desc: Film a wild dog hunt with Julz as he catches up with the Manzi pack at a kill, and watch for leopards and hyenas as the Kakuli pack takes great risks while waiting for the rains to come. Go on an epic hunt with a returning male of the Stork Colony.

programme.title: Into the Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Growing up in the rainforests in the heart of Colombia, a young capuchin monkey has to master his climbing skills, learn how to find food and learn to distinguish friend from foe.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: We follow the South African mangrove forest and its residents through the change from high tide to low and back to high, meeting the red-claw mangrove crabs that keep the forest clean, helping it provide food and shelter for a variety of species.
